title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4022.12 - Power to exclude, suspend
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4022.12 - Power to exclude, suspend

State Regulations

If the steward of the commission shall find that any
person has violated any of the sections of this Subchapter or has been involved
in any action detrimental to the best interests of racing generally, such
steward may exclude such person from the grounds, or any portion of such
grounds, of the association conducting the meeting for a period not exceeding
60 days, or such steward may suspend the license of such person from
participating in racing in this State, for a period not exceeding 60 days, or
both such exclusion and suspension; and if such steward considers necessary any
further action, such steward shall promptly refer the matter to the commission. Such steward, in the exercise of his or her power under this section, shall
consult with the steward of the racing association and the steward of The

Jockey Club, affording them a reasonable opportunity to make recommendations
relative to the action determined by the commission's steward. Nothing in this
section shall be construed to limit any racing association or track licensee's
power to exclude or deny any individual from its grounds or privileges
thereon. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4022.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
